body_html:
Thanks for the reply @ilblackdragon. I'm using the digits example as a guide for my project, which also recreates the error @yangmch first mentioned.

After changing the code to use named arguments in line 57:
classifier.fit(x=X_train, y=y_train, monitors=[val_monitor])

I'm now seeing this error:

/usr/bin/python3.5 /home/anjum/Python/digits.py
WARNING:tensorflow:Using temporary folder as model directory: /tmp/tmp11b6ov7o
WARNING:tensorflow:learn.ops.conv2d is deprecated. Please use contrib.layers.convolution2d.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/anjum/Python/test.py", line 57, in <module>
    classifier.fit(x=X_train, y=y_train, monitors=[val_monitor])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/base.py", line 161, in fit
    monitors=monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/estimator.py", line 508, in _train_model
    monitors=monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 343, in train
    reraise(*excinfo)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/six.py", line 686, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 272, in train
    session, last_step + 1, [train_op, loss_op], feed_dict, monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 121, in _run_with_monitors
    induce_stop = monitor.step_end(step, outputs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/monitors.py", line 206, in step_end
    to_stop = self.every_n_step_end(step, output)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/monitors.py", line 368, in every_n_step_end
    metrics=self.metrics, name=self.name)
TypeError: evaluate() got an unexpected keyword argument 'batch_size'

Process finished with exit code 1

Using the Linux CPU only version in Python 3.5. Tested with v0.9 and the nightly build
body_text:
Thanks for the reply @ilblackdragon. I'm using the digits example as a guide for my project, which also recreates the error @yangmch first mentioned.
After changing the code to use named arguments in line 57:
classifier.fit(x=X_train, y=y_train, monitors=[val_monitor])
I'm now seeing this error:
/usr/bin/python3.5 /home/anjum/Python/digits.py
WARNING:tensorflow:Using temporary folder as model directory: /tmp/tmp11b6ov7o
WARNING:tensorflow:learn.ops.conv2d is deprecated. Please use contrib.layers.convolution2d.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/anjum/Python/test.py", line 57, in <module>
    classifier.fit(x=X_train, y=y_train, monitors=[val_monitor])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/base.py", line 161, in fit
    monitors=monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/estimator.py", line 508, in _train_model
    monitors=monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 343, in train
    reraise(*excinfo)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/six.py", line 686, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 272, in train
    session, last_step + 1, [train_op, loss_op], feed_dict, monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 121, in _run_with_monitors
    induce_stop = monitor.step_end(step, outputs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/monitors.py", line 206, in step_end
    to_stop = self.every_n_step_end(step, output)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/monitors.py", line 368, in every_n_step_end
    metrics=self.metrics, name=self.name)
TypeError: evaluate() got an unexpected keyword argument 'batch_size'

Process finished with exit code 1

Using the Linux CPU only version in Python 3.5. Tested with v0.9 and the nightly build
body:
Thanks for the reply @ilblackdragon. I'm using the [digits example](https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/examples/skflow/digits.py) as a guide for my project, which also recreates the error @yangmch first mentioned.

After changing the code to use named arguments in line 57:
`classifier.fit(x=X_train, y=y_train, monitors=[val_monitor])`

I'm now seeing this error:

```
/usr/bin/python3.5 /home/anjum/Python/digits.py
WARNING:tensorflow:Using temporary folder as model directory: /tmp/tmp11b6ov7o
WARNING:tensorflow:learn.ops.conv2d is deprecated. Please use contrib.layers.convolution2d.
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/anjum/Python/test.py", line 57, in <module>
    classifier.fit(x=X_train, y=y_train, monitors=[val_monitor])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/base.py", line 161, in fit
    monitors=monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/estimators/estimator.py", line 508, in _train_model
    monitors=monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 343, in train
    reraise(*excinfo)
  File "/usr/lib/python3/dist-packages/six.py", line 686, in reraise
    raise value
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 272, in train
    session, last_step + 1, [train_op, loss_op], feed_dict, monitors)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/graph_actions.py", line 121, in _run_with_monitors
    induce_stop = monitor.step_end(step, outputs)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/monitors.py", line 206, in step_end
    to_stop = self.every_n_step_end(step, output)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.5/dist-packages/tensorflow/contrib/learn/python/learn/monitors.py", line 368, in every_n_step_end
    metrics=self.metrics, name=self.name)
TypeError: evaluate() got an unexpected keyword argument 'batch_size'

Process finished with exit code 1
```

Using the Linux CPU only version in Python 3.5. Tested with v0.9 and the nightly build
